column1: Smoque BBQ////The only other things I would add to my experience is that my friend was a little surprised at the location/appearance of the place. I wasn't too shocked
column2: especially when compared to other "BBQ Shack" places
column4: we did drive past it before we noticed the little black awning that signaled we had arrived. The prices on everything seemed quite reasonable and would not say I left there hungry. The platter dishes (helping of meat with no bread) comes with two sides for $11 (incl. tax)
column5: and sandwiches (including one side) just a couple dollars cheaper. They also appear to have a robust catering organization if you needed another option for feeding the masses. If the #2 ranking on Urbanspoon for Chicago restaurants doesn't say it already
column6: the line out the door at 2pm on a Saturday should be enough reason to check it out.
